NFPA-H = | NFPA-F = | NFPA-R = | NFPA-O = | RPhrases = | SPhrases = | RSPhrases = | FlashPt = 47.8 °C | Autoignition = | ExploLimits = | PEL = }} | Section8 = {{Chembox Related | OtherAnions = | OtherCations = | OtherFunctn = | Function = | OtherCpds = }} }} '''Amyl nitrate''' is the [[chemical compound]] with the [[chemical formula|formula]] CH<sub>3</sub>(CH<sub>2</sub>)<sub>4</sub>ONO<sub>2</sub>. This molecule consists of the 5-carbon [[amyl]] group attached to a [[nitrate]] [[functional group]].<ref>[http://epa.gov/ttn/atw/nsps/socww/pt60appj.pdf#search=%221002-16-0%201-Pentyl%20%22 EPA on Pentyl nitrate]</ref> It is the [[ester]] of [[amyl alcohol]] and [[nitric acid]]. ==Applications== Alkyl nitrates are employed as [[reagent]]s in [[organic synthesis]].<ref>{{ cite encyclopedia | author = Zajac, W. W. Jr. | title = 1-Nitropropane | encyclopedia = Encyclopedia of Reagents for Organic Synthesis | year = 2001 | publisher = John Wiley & Sons | doi = 10.1002/047084289X.rn051 }}</ref> Amyl nitrate is used as an additive in diesel fuel, where it acts as an 'ignition improver' by accelerating the ignition of fuel.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}}<!-- nitrate or nitrite? --> ==See also== * [[Poppers]] - the recreational drugs * [[Amyl nitrite]] - a similarly named chemical used to treat [[ischaemic heart disease|heart disease]]s and [[cyanide poisoning]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Alkyl nitrates]]
